sentences.en: An active conscience is a fine and healthy thing, of course. But contrition must not be limited to certain parties while innocence is accorded to anyone who claims to be persecuted.
sentences.cn: 这种悔恨的思潮像流行病一样传遍了民间与政府，适度的表现良知是件好事，但是悔悟不应该仅仅局限于当事人一方，清白也不应该给予任何一个自称受到迫害的人。

sentences.en: Blankfein was clearly trying to placate the locals and show some kind of contrition.
sentences.cn: 布兰克费恩显然在尽力抚慰德国人,并表现出一定的悔悟.

sentences.en: His press conference on Wednesday was full of conciliation that bordered on contrition.
sentences.cn: 周三(注:11月8日)记者会充满近似悔悟的妥协.

sentences.en: In contrition she expatiated on the beauty of the garden.
sentences.cn: 在后悔中,她反复谈论着花园的美丽.

sentences.en: It is contrition and faith and love that enable the soul to receive wisdom from heaven.
sentences.cn: 人必须兼有痛悔、信心和爱心,才能领受上天所赐的智慧.

sentences.en: She forgave him because his contrition was real.
sentences.cn: 她原谅了他是由于他的懊悔是真心的。

sentences.en: The name we give to this spiritual condition is contrition.
sentences.cn: 我们将这一属灵状况称为悔悟.

sentences.en: Through her own contrition, Karen learned that she herself was weak and afraid.
sentences.cn: 通过自我反省, 凯伦意识到她自己也很脆弱、胆怯.

sentences.en: Toad, who was on the sofa by this time, with his legs up, rolled over on his face, shaken by sobs of contrition.
sentences.cn: 蟾蜍正翘腿倚在沙发上，听到这话，侧身掩面，全身抖动，痛悔地抽泣起来。

words.tran_cn: 悔悟了的；后悔的；悔罪的
